result.execSummary:
The defendant Kathryn Rochelle Schmidt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to any sentence presently being served.

miscConds.notes:
Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.
Maintain full-time employment, schooling or a combination of both.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: COUNT 1 ONLY - Huber Law, STAYED, and to be imposed at the agent's discretion and upon order of the Court.

records.addlTxt: Instructions for How to Appear Remotely.

4:07 pm - Defendant Kathryn Rochelle Schmidt appeared by video, in custody, in Green Lake County Jail.  Attorney Marcus Lasalle Falk appeared by video for Kathryn Rochelle Schmidt.  Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.  Offer extended in email dated 09-02-22.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Plea hearing on September 27, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely.
Preliminary hearing on September 22, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Green Lake County Jail never zoomed in for this preliminary hearing.  Attorney Falk to contact JA to get new date.
Warrant Quashed and original returned to Clerk's office.
Preliminary hearing on September 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:35 pm - Defendant Kathryn Rochelle Schmidt appeared by video, in custody, at Green Lake County Jail.   Attorney Marcus Lasalle Falk appeared by video for Kathryn Rochelle Schmidt.  Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing demanded. Court quashes warrant.  Preliminary hearing is set for 09-07-22 at 3:00 p.m.

Instructions for How to Appear Remotely.
Preliminary hearing on September 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Email correspondence.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant failed to appear for initial appearance.  State requests warrant. Court authorizes warrant.
Minutes.
Marcus Falk through Public Defender

Defendant in custody.   
Initial appearance is reset to 08-15-22 at 1:30 p.m. to allow public defender more time to appoint counsel.  
Minutes.

ADDRESS INFO for Kathryn Rochelle Schmidt
Current: 1031 S. 21st Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220   (Effective: 07-15-2022)
Prior: 1114 S 7Th St, Manitowoc, WI 54220
Re:  Felony bail jumping, on 06-26-22.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of felony bail jumping, possess fentanyl, possess THC and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 07-18-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant is to have no contact with Blake Sprang and Jessica Fenlon and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
